story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in the beautiful country of Tajikistan, there was a young boy named Ali. Ali was a kind and curious boy who loved to explore the world around him. He lived with his father, a skilled craftsman, and his mother, a nurturing and loving woman.

One day, Ali asked his father, "Baba, why is the sky blue?" His father smiled and replied, "My dear son, there is a story behind the color of the sky. Let me tell you a bedtime story that has been passed down from generation to generation in our family."

Ali snuggled close to his father as he began the story. "Long ago, there was a powerful and wise king who ruled over a vast kingdom. This king had a beautiful and magical sky-blue carpet, which he cherished more than anything in the world. The carpet was so magical that it could heal the sick and bring happiness to those who were sad. The king would fly on this carpet, high above the clouds, to find the rarest and most precious gems to decorate his palace.

One day, the king's trusted advisor warned him of a terrible drought that was going to strike the kingdom. The king knew that the drought would bring great hardship and sorrow to his people, so he decided to use his magical carpet to find a solution. He flew high up into the sky, searching for a hidden spring that was rumored to hold an endless supply of water.

After a long and arduous journey, the king finally found the spring. It was guarded by powerful dragons who demanded the king hand over his magical carpet in exchange for the water. The king knew that without the carpet, he wouldn't be able to heal the sick and bring happiness to his people, but he also knew that the people's survival was more important than his own desires. So, with a heavy heart, the king sacrificed his beloved carpet to save his people.

As soon as the king handed over the carpet, the dragons released a great torrent of water from the spring. The water flowed down from the mountains and filled the rivers and lakes, bringing life back to the parched land. The people were overjoyed and celebrated the king's bravery and selflessness.

From that day on, the sky took on the color of the magical carpet, as a reminder of the king's sacrifice. And that, my dear Ali, is why the sky is blue."

Ali's father finished the story and kissed him goodnight. Ali closed his eyes, feeling grateful for his father's wisdom and the beautiful story. From then on, every time Ali looked up at the sky, he was reminded of the power of love and sacrifice. And every time he asked his father a question, he knew he would receive a thoughtful and meaningful answer, just like the story of the sky-blue carpet.

The end.

Good night, my dear son, sweet dreams, and may you always have a curious and open mind.
